DataElement.preferredName: Image Computed Tomography (CT) Pitch Factor 8 Byte Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Ratio of the Table Feed per Rotation (0018,9310) to the Total Collimation Width (0018,9307).  See C.8.15.3.4.1 for further explanation and some examples. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Acquisition Type (0018,9302) is SPIRAL.  May be present otherwise if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is DERIVED and Acquisition Type (0018,9302) is SPIRAL.   [Standard-based]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic._A piece of furniture having a smooth flat top that is usually supported by one or more vertical legs or any object of a similar appearance._A scalar measure of the rate of movement of the object expressed either as the distance travelled divided by the time taken (average speed) or the rate of change of position with respect to time at a particular point (instantaneous speed)._A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis._The degree of deviation from a horizontal plane._Factor; anything that contributes causally to a result.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Property.preferredDefinition: A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.:The degree of deviation from a horizontal plane.:Anything that contributes causally to a result.

Concepts.definition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.
The degree of deviation from a horizontal plane.
Anything that contributes causally to a result.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/22/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: FD:Double precision binary floating point number prepresented in IEEE 754:1985 64-bit Floating Point Number Format. [Standard-based]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: No value exists.:A sequence of 8 bits processed as a single unit of information.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A sequence of 8 bits processed as a single unit of information.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 6/21/07-Released for NCIA CDE curation. ;  5/10/07- removed DICOM as a Property Qualifier.  12/18/06 - DICOM FD Value Representation type.

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 10/27/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes
